intro: Gnaphalium heterotrichum, commonly known as the woolly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its fluffy, silvery foliage gives it a distinctive appearance, and it is sometimes used in floral arrangements.
